results.name: Number T(n,k) of permutations of [n] whose difference between the length of the longest increasing subsequence and the length of the longest decreasing subsequence equals k; triangle T(n,k), n >= 1, 1-n <= k <= n-1, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..80, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n) option remember; g(n$2, []) end:
mathematica: h[l_] := With[{n = Length[l]}, Total[l]!/Product[Product[1 + l[[i]] - j + Sum[If[j > l[[k]], 0, 1], {k, i + 1, n}], {j, 1, l[[i]]}], {i, 1, n}]];
g[n_, i_, l_] := If[n == 0 || i == 1, f[Join[l, Table[1, {n}]]], g[n, i - 1, l] + g[n - i, Min[i, n - i], Append[l, i]]];
